intro: Leptosema macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited leptosema, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by elliptical berries that contain a single seed. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local wildlife.
